speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. Britain. The garden of Cymbeline's palace.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Enter two Gentlemen

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: You do not meet a man but frowns: our bloods

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: No more obey the heavens than our courtiers

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Still seem as does the king.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: But what's the matter?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: His daughter, and the heir of's kingdom, whom

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He purposed to his wife's sole son--a widow

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: That late he married--hath referr'd herself

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Unto a poor but worthy gentleman: she's wedded;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Her husband banish'd; she imprison'd: all

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Is outward sorrow; though I think the king

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Be touch'd at very heart.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: None but the king?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He that hath lost her too; so is the queen,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: That most desired the match; but not a courtier,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Although they wear their faces to the bent

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Of the king's look's, hath a heart that is not

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Glad at the thing they scowl at.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: And why so?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He that hath miss'd the princess is a thing

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Too bad for bad report: and he that hath her--

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I mean, that married her, alack, good man!

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And therefore banish'd--is a creature such

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: As, to seek through the regions of the earth

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: For one his like, there would be something failing

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: In him that should compare. I do not think

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: So fair an outward and such stuff within

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Endows a man but he.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: You speak him far.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I do extend him, sir, within himself,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Crush him together rather than unfold

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: His measure duly.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: What's his name and birth?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I cannot delve him to the root: his father

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Was call'd Sicilius, who did join his honour

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Against the Romans with Cassibelan,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: But had his titles by Tenantius whom

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He served with glory and admired success,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: So gain'd the sur-addition Leonatus;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And had, besides this gentleman in question,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Two other sons, who in the wars o' the time

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Died with their swords in hand; for which

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: their father,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Then old and fond of issue, took such sorrow

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: That he quit being, and his gentle lady,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Big of this gentleman our theme, deceased

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: As he was born. The king he takes the babe

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: To his protection, calls him Posthumus Leonatus,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Breeds him and makes him of his bed-chamber,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Puts to him all the learnings that his time

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Could make him the receiver of; which he took,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: As we do air, fast as 'twas minister'd,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: And in's spring became a harvest, lived in court--

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Which rare it is to do--most praised, most loved,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: A sample to the youngest, to the more mature

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: A glass that feated them, and to the graver

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: A child that guided dotards; to his mistress,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: For whom he now is banish'd, her own price

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Proclaims how she esteem'd him and his virtue;

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: By her election may be truly read

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: What kind of man he is.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I honour him

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Even out of your report. But, pray you, tell me,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Is she sole child to the king?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: His only child.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: He had two sons: if this be worth your hearing,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Mark it: the eldest of them at three years old,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I' the swathing-clothes the other, from their nursery

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Were stol'n, and to this hour no guess in knowledge

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Which way they went.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: How long is this ago?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Some twenty years.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That a king's children should be so convey'd,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: So slackly guarded, and the search so slow,

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: That could not trace them!

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Howsoe'er 'tis strange,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Or that the negligence may well be laugh'd at,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Yet is it true, sir.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I do well believe you.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: We must forbear: here comes the gentleman,

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The queen, and princess.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Enter the QUEEN, POSTHUMUS LEONATUS, and IMOGEN

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: No, be assured you shall not find me, daughter,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: After the slander of most stepmothers,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Evil-eyed unto you: you're my prisoner, but

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Your gaoler shall deliver you the keys

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That lock up your restraint. For you, Posthumus,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: So soon as I can win the offended king,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I will be known your advocate: marry, yet

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The fire of rage is in him, and 'twere good

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: You lean'd unto his sentence with what patience

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Your wisdom may inform you.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Please your highness,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I will from hence to-day.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: You know the peril.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I'll fetch a turn about the garden, pitying

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The pangs of barr'd affections, though the king

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Hath charged you should not speak together.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: O

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Dissembling courtesy! How fine this tyrant

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Can tickle where she wounds! My dearest husband,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I something fear my father's wrath; but nothing--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Always reserved my holy duty--what

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: His rage can do on me: you must be gone;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And I shall here abide the hourly shot

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Of angry eyes, not comforted to live,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But that there is this jewel in the world

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That I may see again.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: My queen! my mistress!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: O lady, weep no more, lest I give cause

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: To be suspected of more tenderness

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Than doth become a man. I will remain

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The loyal'st husband that did e'er plight troth:

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: My residence in Rome at one Philario's,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Who to my father was a friend, to me

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Known but by letter: thither write, my queen,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: And with mine eyes I'll drink the words you send,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Though ink be made of gall.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Re-enter QUEEN

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Be brief, I pray you:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: If the king come, I shall incur I know not

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: How much of his displeasure.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Aside

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Yet I'll move him

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To walk this way: I never do him wrong,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: But he does buy my injuries, to be friends;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Pays dear for my offences.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Should we be taking leave

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: As long a term as yet we have to live,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The loathness to depart would grow. Adieu!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Nay, stay a little:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Were you but riding forth to air yourself,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Such parting were too petty. Look here, love;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: This diamond was my mother's: take it, heart;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But keep it till you woo another wife,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When Imogen is dead.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: How, how! another?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: You gentle gods, give me but this I have,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: And sear up my embracements from a next

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: With bonds of death!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Putting on the ring

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Remain, remain thou here

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: While sense can keep it on. And, sweetest, fairest,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: As I my poor self did exchange for you,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: To your so infinite loss, so in our trifles

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I still win of you: for my sake wear this;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: It is a manacle of love; I'll place it

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Upon this fairest prisoner.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Putting a bracelet upon her arm

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: O the gods!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When shall we see again?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter CYMBELINE and Lords

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Alack, the king!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou basest thing, avoid! hence, from my sight!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: If after this command thou fraught the court

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: With thy unworthiness, thou diest: away!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou'rt poison to my blood.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The gods protect you!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: And bless the good remainders of the court! I am gone.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: There cannot be a pinch in death

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: More sharp than this is.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: O disloyal thing,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That shouldst repair my youth, thou heap'st

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A year's age on me.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I beseech you, sir,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Harm not yourself with your vexation

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am senseless of your wrath; a touch more rare

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Subdues all pangs, all fears.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Past grace? obedience?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Past hope, and in despair; that way, past grace.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: That mightst have had the sole son of my queen!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: O blest, that I might not! I chose an eagle,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And did avoid a puttock.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou took'st a beggar; wouldst have made my throne

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A seat for baseness.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: No; I rather added

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A lustre to it.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: O thou vile one!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: It is your fault that I have loved Posthumus:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You bred him as my playfellow, and he is

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A man worth any woman, overbuys me

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Almost the sum he pays.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: What, art thou mad?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Almost, sir: heaven restore me! Would I were

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A neat-herd's daughter, and my Leonatus

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Our neighbour shepherd's son!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Thou foolish thing!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Re-enter QUEEN

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: They were again together: you have done

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Not after our command. Away with her,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And pen her up.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Beseech your patience. Peace,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Dear lady daughter, peace! Sweet sovereign,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Leave us to ourselves; and make yourself some comfort

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Out of your best advice.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Nay, let her languish

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: A drop of blood a day; and, being aged,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Die of this folly!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exeunt CYMBELINE and Lords

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Fie! you must give way.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Enter PISANIO

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Here is your servant. How now, sir! What news?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: My lord your son drew on my master.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: No harm, I trust, is done?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: There might have been,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: But that my master rather play'd than fought

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: And had no help of anger: they were parted

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: By gentlemen at hand.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I am very glad on't.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Your son's my father's friend; he takes his part.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To draw upon an exile! O brave sir!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I would they were in Afric both together;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Myself by with a needle, that I might prick

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The goer-back. Why came you from your master?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: On his command: he would not suffer me

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: To bring him to the haven; left these notes

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Of what commands I should be subject to,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: When 't pleased you to employ me.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: This hath been

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Your faithful servant: I dare lay mine honour

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: He will remain so.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I humbly thank your highness.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Pray, walk awhile.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: About some half-hour hence,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I pray you, speak with me: you shall at least

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Go see my lord aboard: for this time leave me.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Exeunt
